reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel in a historic building (built in 1527). We had a room in the back which overlooked an art institute. We had a birds-eye view in the morning of art students painting, sculpting, etc. in the studios and patios of the school.
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was huge and had a very modern bathroom and a good air conditioner (important in Jul/Aug in Florence). The staff were very helpful and the breakfast buffet was first-rate.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.text: One of the previous reviewers was put off by the lack of "life" in the piazza in front of the hotel. This lack of activity at night was *exactly* the reason we wanted to be in this hotel. The last time we stayed in Florence we were in a hotel on a busy square with plenty of nightlife -- which went on until 4 a.m. and which was very audible from our room. Another review mentioned vagrants on the street. It's true, there were a couple of down-and-out types hanging around but they were easily ignored. Anyone who has traveled to any large American or European city should (sadly) be used to this.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Loggiato dei Serviti in Florence

likes.liked: — huge beautiful rooms, modern clean bathroom
likes.disliked: — the vagrants that lived in the square

reviews.text: We will definitely go back to this place the next time we're in Florence.
reviews.title: In search of the holy grail

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and a florentine style to the decor
likes.disliked: — Smelly tramps and aggressive beggars; noise at night

reviews.text: I loved this hotel. While its a little walk away from some of the major attractions...I found it to be perfectly located because of all the quaint shops and restaurants nearby. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and the room service was amazing (we had bellini's everynight before heading out). the view from our room was great and everything about the hotel felt traditional and non-tourisy. something about this hotel holds great memories in my mind...i would certainly go back! florence is so beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Great 3 star boutique hotel in Florence, Italy
reviews.text: My wife and I and 2 other couples spent two nights at this charming hotel in Florence in September, 2005, at the back end of a cycling trip in Southern Tuscany with Backroads (see my review on the biking trip separately under "Backroads").

This hotel is a very good choice for those looking for an unconventional, boutique-like small hotel with lots of charm. It's pretty good value, we paid 200 Euros at the height of the tourist season including breakfast. The rooms are spacious and nice, although I recommend you specifically ask for rooms at the back of the hotel which are much quieter than the ones in the front which face the Piazza Annunziata. The location is pretty good, not perfect, since you're about a 15 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio and the Galleria Uffizi, but then again, Florence is very walkable and nothing is too far. The hotel is also around the corner from the "David". All in all, we liked it a lot.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: My wife and I began our Italian honeymoon in Florence and stayed at Hotel Loggiato dei Serviti. We found it to be a perfect place to start our trip. The staff was extremely helpful from check-in to checkout. In fact, our best dinner that we had in Italy was at a place recommended by the woman working the desk (Mama Gina's...very good). Our room was very clean and spacious. It was at the back of the hotel, which was fortunate since (as many other reviewers have mentioned) there was music in the piazza outside the hotel during the evening. The music usually lasted until around midnight. We thought it was cool to have a concert outside our front door. I'm sure if we had a room in the front of the hotel, we would have had a different opinion, though. The breakfast was decent. It consisted of the standard fare - bread, fruit, ham, cheeses, cereal, coffee, etc. As some others have mentioned, the bed was pretty hard. They were like that in every place that we stayed throughout Italy. If you want a soft bed, you're better off at a Westin or Sheraton. The only issue we had was at checkout. I was almost overcharged for the room. Fortunately, I had my email confirmation with me and was able to confirm the correct price with the staff. Overall, it was an extremely pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Big Disappointment!
Loggiato dei Serviti very disappointing
reviews.text: This was my third visit to the Loggiato dei Serviti since 1996 and I had pleasant memories of the beautiful public spaces, the gorgeous public square, the fine staff and small, but charming, clean rooms. No such luck on this trip! The piazza has definitely gone downhill in attracting a seedy bunch of people who lounge on the steps and stagger around the piazza at night. The staff was not friendly this time and our room was unacceptable. The bed was like sleeping on plywood and the worst part was a horrible smell (like a backed up sewer or toilet) that permeated our room the second morning we were there. While the location is great, we will NOT go back. I think the management has not done a good job with keeping the place up to date - everything is tired and worn looking. A real shame since this had been a top notch hotel in the past.

We stayed in the Loggiato dei serviti three years ago and had a great time. The hotel dates to the early 1500's so you automatically feel steeped in the history of Florence. It is close to most of the attractions and on paper fits the bill.
reviews.title: Small Gem
Didn't live up to its pictures
reviews.text: My parents and I stayed at the Loggiato dei Serviti in Florence for two nights. I chose this hotel because it was near the Accademia Museum and I thought being a bit towards the outskirts of central Florence would be better for us.

reviews.title: Adored this hotel, Memorable Anniversary
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel it was in a big, empty square with homeless people sitting all over the stairs and benches surrounding the area. The smell of urine was pugnant in the still, summer air. There is a small door leading into the hotel, past a sleeping homeless woman.
The staff at the hotel were not unfriendly, but also not very helpful. When asked a simple question the answer was not very informative.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but ask for the right room!
Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: We went up to the room (I had asked for a quiet room) and were greeted with a view of an interior alley with piles of boxes and left-over junk. There was also a note that a mosquito plug-in would help ward off the pesky critters! We sometimes like to open the window to let in the night air-but this warned us off of that idea!

reviews.title: Enjoyed it
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night here in November 2006. We both loved it. The hotel is beautiful. It's very close to the Duomo and the Academia, and about a 10 minute walk from the Uffizi. It's in a quieter part of the city with less traffic, but I still used my earplugs at night. The room was big and comfortable. And, we had a balcony overlooking the piazza that was nice.
The floors are a little creaky and the elevator was tiny and scared me too much, so I took the stairs. But, otherwise it was a great experience that I'd recommend.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a few homeless people sleeping in the square, but they seemed harmless. I felt totally safe.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel came highly recommended to us so we were really looking forward to our time here. The piazza was such a let down, we had imagined a buzzing square with lots of atmosphere but there is literally nothing! and no people except a few tramps with barking dogs that were fighting one night when we returned to our room. Such a shame as other corners of Florence have fun, atmospheric squares that are a joy to be in.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location!
Fantastic location! As romantic as can be...
reviews.text: We were given a room in the dependencia, which is a seperate building around the corner. This was awful, so scary. I was staying there with my mum and i did not feel at all safe, two females on their own. You go up three flights and there are only 4 other rooms in that building that have guests, the rest are offices! You even need to go through two seperate set of doors with extra keys...do not stay in this part.
